isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: For the following, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual EGES-175 (DT 466E/530E) or EGES-190 (T444E):

item.para: Low Oil Pressure/High Water Temperature/Brake Warning (Air) and Low Coolant Level Lights and Alarm
Low Oil Pressure/High Water Temperature/Brake Warning (Hyd.) and Low Coolant Level Lights and Alarm
Diagnostic/Programming Connector and Self-Test Switch and Warning Light System

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect green connector (11) from cluster. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28/A28B, then repair.
At connector (11), measure voltage across circuit A28B to A28-G.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuits A28-G/ A11-GB/ A11-G, then repair.
At connector (11), install jumper wire from circuit A28B to A36. Disconnect sender connector (37). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A36 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A36 or conn. (2 or 2A), then repair.
At connector (37), measure voltage across circuit N36 to N36-G.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit N36-G/ N11-G, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect cluster connector (11) and sender connector (37).
Fuel level gauge circuitry checks good. If condition still persists, refer to S08314 to diagnose the gauge and sender.

svcsubproc.title: Low Air Pressure Warning Light and Alarm System

table.title: Low Air Pressure Warning Light and Alarm System

entry.para: With air pressure below 60 psi, do BOTH the warning light and alarm fail to operate?
With air pressure below 60 psi, does the alarm operate but the warning light does not?
With air pressure below 60 psi, does the warning light operate properly but the alarm does not?
At low air pressure switch (1LA), remove connector and jumper circuit K40 to ground. Turn key ON. Does the warning system work?
Disconnect alarm (211) and measure resistance from cavity 2 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40 or conn. (2) or (9850), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect switch (1LA). Warning system ground circuitry checks good.
Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair.
Disconnect natural connector (12) from IP cluster. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28/A28D, then repair.
Remove alarm (R1) and install jumper from cavity A to ground. At connector (12), measure voltage across circuit A28D to A40A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A40A, then repair.
Remove bulb and check for open condition.
Replace IP cluster. Go to next step.
Replace bulb. Go to next step.
Remove jumpers and reconnect connectors. Warning light power circuits check good.
Remove fuse F24 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F24, measure voltage from circuit A13H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A13/A13H, then repair.
Remove alarm (211) and at cavity 5, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13B, then repair.
Reconnect alarm. Alarm power circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Brake Low Fluid and Parking Brake Warning Lights

table.title: Hydraulic Brake Low Fluid and Parking Brake Warning Lights

entry.para: Do both bulbs operate when key switch is in the start position?
Does the low brake fluid warning light operate properly?
With parking brake applied, does the parking brake warning light operate properly?
Disconnect parking brake switch connector (218). At circuit A44-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A44-GA/ A11-GB, then repair.
At park brake switch connector, install jumper wire from circuit A44A to ground and turn key on. Does light work?
Disconnect natural dash connector (12). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A28C/A28, then repair.
At connector (12), measure voltage across circuit A28C to A44.
Check bulb. If OK, replace cluster.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A44, conn. (82), or circuit A44A, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connectors. Park brake circuitry checks OK.
Remove low brake fluid level sensor connector (90). At connector, measure resistance from circuit N11-GF to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits N11-GF/ N11-GB, then repair.
At connector, install jumper wire from circuit N90P to ground. Does light operate?
Remove low brake fluid light connector (89). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A90R to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90R/A28A, then repair.
At connector (89), measure voltage across circuit A90R to A90V.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90V, conn. (2), or circuit A90P, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connectors. Low brake fluid light circuitry checks good.
Disconnect key switch (20). Hold switch in start position and measure resistance from ground terminal of switch to its case.
Reconnect connector (20) and disconnect brake diode assembly (82). With key in start position, measure resistance from circuit A44-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A44-G (and/or A31-GD with trans. filter, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, check blocking diode (82). Is diode good?
At connector (82), measure voltage from circuit A90W to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90W/A90V, warning light conn. (89), or circuit A90R, then repair.
At connector (82), measure voltage from circuit A44/A44A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A44, warning light, or circuit A28C, then repair.
Bulb check ground circuitry checks good. If bulbs still do not operate properly, go to Step 2 and 3.
Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground. Replace fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair.
Disconnect engine/ chassis harness connector (9850). Install jumper from circuit K31A to ground. Does warning light illuminate?
Reconnect (9850) and disconnect warning light switch connector (N/L). Measure voltage from circuit K31A to ground.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuit K31A, then repair.
Disconnect dash connector (2). At (2), measure resistance of circuit A31A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A31A, then repair.
Disconnect warning light connector (11) and measure voltage from circuit A28B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28B/A28, then repair.
At (11) install jumper from circuit A28B to circuit A31A. At dash connector (2), measure voltage from circuit A31A to ground.
Replace cluster. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A31A, then repair. Go to next step.
Remove jumpers and reconnect connectors (9850), (2), and (11).
Does the warning light work when the key switch is in the start position?
Remove fuse F10 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F10, measure voltage from circuit A12A to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A12A, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect jumper harness from filter pigtail connector (N/L). Measure resistance from brown wire to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in brown wire, conn. (344), or circuit A11-GE, then repair.
At jumper harness, install jumper from brown wire to blue wire. Disconnect warning light connector (94) and measure voltage from circuit A31D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A31D, then repair.
At (94), measure voltage across circuit A31D to A31-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A31-GA, conn. (344), or blue wire, then repair.
Remove jumper, reconnect (94), and filter pigtail to jumper harness connector.
Disconnect circuit A31-GD conn. from key switch (20) and install jumper to ground. Does light operate?
Disconnect rectifier assembly (64) and measure resistance from circuit A31-GC to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A31-GC or A31-GD, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, check rectifier assembly (64). Test good?
Reconnect (64) and disconnect jumper harness from filter switch pigtail. At jumper, measure resistance from green wire to ground.
Jumper harness, green wire to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in green wire, conn. (344) or circuit A31-GB, then repair.
At filter switch pigtail, measure resistance from white wire to black wire.
(N/L) switch pigtail, white to black wire.
At filter switch pigtail, measure resistance from red wire to black wire.
(N/L) switch pigtail, red to black wire.
Install jumper lead from jumper harness blue wire to ground. Disconnect warning light connector (94). Measure voltage from circuit A31D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A31D, then repair.
At (94), measure voltage across circuit A31D to A31-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A31-GA, conn. (344), or the blue wire, then repair.
Remove jumpers and reconnect key switch ground connector, filter switch pigtail and warning light connector (94).
Warning light bulb check circuits check good.
